titleInfo.title: USA v. Roberts
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. A hearing was held before me March 6, 2007 on allegations made in the amended petition for action on conditions of pretrial release. IT THEREFORE HEREBY IS ORDERED: 1. The previous order releasing the defendant on conditions, filing 10, is amended. 2. The pretrial services officer shall investigate the defendant's request to associate with Katherine Prang and report to the court and counsel as soon as practicable. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(JAR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. A hearing was held before me March 6, 2007 on allegations made in the amended petition for action on conditions of pretrial release. IT THEREFORE HEREBY IS ORDERED: 1. The previous order releasing the defendant on conditions, filing 10, is amended. 2. The pretrial services officer shall investigate the defendant's request to associate with Katherine Prang and report to the court and counsel as soon as practicable. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(JAR)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Roberts
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. It is ordered that: (1) There are no disputed matters regarding the presentence report and the proper computation of the advisory Guidelines ranges. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. It is ordered that: (1) There are no disputed matters regarding the presentence report and the proper computation of the advisory Guidelines ranges. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Roberts
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Richard Gene Roberts (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 120 months, followed by 5 years supervised release with special conditions, and pay Special Assessment in the amount of $100 as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. Defendant remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshal. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified Copies to USM)(CS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Roberts
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that counsel for defendant shall withdraw exhibit 101 received at the 3/6/07 hearing on pretrial release within 15 days or show cause why exhibit should not be destroyed as to defendant(s) Richard Gene Roberts. If counsel fails to withdraw the exhibit or show cause why it should not be destroyed, the clerk's office is directed to destroy the exhibit without further notice. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (CCB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER that counsel for defendant shall withdraw exhibit 101 received at the 3/6/07 hearing on pretrial release within 15 days or show cause why exhibit should not be destroyed as to defendant(s) Richard Gene Roberts. If counsel fails to withdraw the exhibit or show cause why it should not be destroyed, the clerk's office is directed to destroy the exhibit without further notice. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (CCB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Roberts
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. It is ordered that: (1) The government's motion for hearing is granted. (2) A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 44 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Friday, January 18, 2008, at 12:00 noon, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. (3) The United States Marshal is directed to return the defendant to the district for the hearing.(4) Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw. (5) The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher. (6) The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. It is ordered that: (1) The government's motion for hearing is granted. (2) A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 44 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Friday, January 18, 2008, at 12:00 noon, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. (3) The United States Marshal is directed to return the defendant to the district for the hearing.(4) Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw. (5) The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher. (6) The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Roberts
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT (Reduction of Sentence) as to Richard Gene Roberts (1). The defendant pleaded guilty to Count 1 of the indictment and defendant's sentence of imprisonment is reduced from the original sentence of 120 months to 60 months, followed by 5 years supervised release with special conditions, and pay special assessment in the amount of $100 (a balance of $50.00 remains) as to defendant Richard Gene Roberts. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(CCB)

Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(CCB)
